entry.title: Sao Sanda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sao Sanda (pictured), the last princess of Yawnghwe, is one of only two living princesses to have attended the 1947 Panglong Conference?

entry.title: Gene Cipriano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gene Cipriano played the saxophone part for Tony Curtis's character in the film Some Like It Hot?

entry.title: global majority (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Westminster City Council in London agreed to use "global majority" as a more inclusive term than BAME or "ethnic minority", a Conservative MP called it "deeply sinister"?

entry.title: Hit and Run (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rhea Seehorn wanted the sprinkler in the cold open to the Better Call Saul episode "Hit and Run" to sound like a machine gun?

entry.title: being found hanged in his hotel room (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after leaving his job promoting Qatar ahead of the 2022 World Cup, Marc Bennett alleged he was tortured before being found hanged in his hotel room?

entry.title: Sophia Lucia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at age 10, Sophia Lucia surpassed the world record for consecutive pirouettes by 19 turns?

entry.title: Löderup Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the medieval baptismal font of Löderup Church in Sweden contains a depiction of a ship with a dragon's head at the stem, similar to a Viking ship?

entry.title: bat phone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New York mayor Michael Bloomberg said that the only calls on his bat phone were from salespeople offering magazine subscriptions or insurance policies?
